message.entry: Specify the full path to the install folder.
Specify the full path to the download folder.
Specify the full path to the folder where you want to install the documentation.
Specify the full path to the downloaded product files.
Specify the full path to the mounted documentation ISO.

Specify the list of products and support packages to install using their names separated by spaces. Replace spaces within names with underscores. For example: MATLAB Simulink Deep_Learning_Toolbox Parallel_Computing_Toolbox Modelscape_for_MATLAB.

Specify the list of products and support packages to download using their names separated by spaces. Replace spaces within names with underscores. For example: MATLAB Simulink Deep_Learning_Toolbox Parallel_Computing_Toolbox Modelscape_for_MATLAB.
Specify the platforms of the products and support packages to download. Separate multiple platforms by spaces. Valid platforms: glnxa64 win64 maci64 maca64
Install documentation. Supported in R2022b and older releases only. To install documentation in a newer release, use the install-doc command.
Specify the full path to the folder where MATLAB and other products are installed.
Do not include GPU libraries when installing products. The {0} argument is supported in R2023a and newer releases only.
Do not include the default Java Runtime when installing products.
Do not include unspecified dependent licensed products when downloading.
Install selected products and support packages
Download selected products and support packages

mpm is a command line package manager for MathWorks products. Use this command to install MATLAB and its toolboxes programmatically. The mpm command provides options to customize your installation, for example, you can specify the MATLAB release, install destination, and specific products to install.
Specify the full path to the input file. Note: You must specify --inputfile without any other options.
Note: In R2023b or earlier, uninstalling products is not supported.
